title: Scalia's Legacy Lives On As Court Transforms Law
itunes:title: Scalia's Legacy Lives On As Court Transforms Law
description:
Elizabeth Wydra, President of the Constitutional Accountability Center, discusses how the legacy of the late Justice Antonin Scalia, the champion of originalism, lives on in the current court's decisions.
Robert Clarida, who heads the intellectual property practice at Reitler Kailas & Rosenblatt, discusses musician Kelis’ claim that she wasn’t properly credited on Beyoncé's new album “Renaissance.”
June Grasso hosts.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.
